New Records: Jaylen Brown scored a season-high 44 points, becoming the fourth player in franchise history to have at least 40 points and four steals in a regular-season game.
Key Match Events: The Pacers struggled defensively, allowing the Celtics to score 142 points, the most given up by Indiana this season.
Pre-Game Insights: Jaylen Brown emphasized his defensive impact, highlighting his ability to guard top-tier guards, and Payton Pritchard praised his two-way play.
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics ended a two-game losing streak, and Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton acknowledged the challenge of facing Boston's star power.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the third and final meeting between the teams during the regular season, with the Pacers having won their previous encounter in overtime.
Others: The Pacers were outrebounded 52-39 and struggled with offensive rebounding and turnovers, contributing to their poor performance.
